description:
Strategic objectives: The goal (impact level) of the DERF is to prevent loss of life and escalation of suffering among people affected by an acute humanitarian crisis. By establishing a pool of funds that is rapid, effective, and relevant, with integrity and flexibility (output level), the DERF responds to acute humanitarian crisis situations and reaches affected populations by responding to their needs (outcome level).

description:
The objective of Denmark’s support for UNHCR is to address needs in forced displacement contexts and thereby contributing to the achievement of Agenda 2030’s commitment to “leave no one behind” and in particular Sustainable Development Goals (SDG) 1, 5, 10 and 161, as well as the main priorities of Denmark’s strategy for development cooperation, The World We Share, relating to poverty, fragility, conflict and creating viable alternatives to forced displacement and irregular migration. It also supports Danish government’s ambition for a fair and humane asylum system within international law by focusing in protection and self-reliance for refugees thus helping refugees in humanitarian settings and areas bordering conflict.

description:
Denmark's priority areas for cooperation with ICRC in 2025-2028 are as follows: 1. Protection and delivery of essential services to people affected by conflict, 2. Promotion and compliance with IHL, 3. Synergies between humanitarian and development efforts/Sustainable Humanitarian Impact (HDP-nexus), 4. Climate and conflict, 5. Enhance organizational efficiency and effectiveness of the ICRC.
